message.title: Web Conferencing | GoToMeeting
message.body: Here is the link for our Go-To-Meeting account. #sales #meetings

comment.text: Thanks Jennifer. Glad it's in our company stream. Won't lose it anymore.

message.title: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hbXLOeICLOI
message.body: Great video podcast on "Measuring Your Marketing Success" /cc @LindaAllen

comment.text: Have we ever thought about doing a podcast? A buddy of mine at another company does them, he says that they have had a lot of success with them. Just a thought.
Great idea Bob. This has been something we have been tossing around in the Marketing department in our last few meetings.
Sounds great. I know the software engineering team would be interested in doing some for our development community.

message.body: Had a great lunch with @PaulGandy about initial concepts for the widget 11 software design. See attached. Comments welcome.

comment.text: I like the idea. Have we thought about using the reverse pattern a algorithms that worked well in Widget 9?
Nice thinking Emily. Using that code base never entered my mind. That is going to save a lot of development time. Thanks for the help.

Another good point to Emily's idea of using the reverse a algorithm is that it could help with the server resource issue that we were concerned about. One of the main objectives of that code base was reducing server load to free up resources for other processes. Great suggestion, Emily!
Good point Paul. @MikeWhittington, could you send me the reference docs for the reverse a algorithm. I want to get started reviewing the code to see if it will work in this application.
Here you go Bob. This is version 7. Version 8 never left beta. #FYI #reference #code

message.body: How will administration work for Widget 11? Will a self-service tool or alert be used?

comment.text: Administration of Widget 11 will be very similar to Widget 10. It will include all the same features, so training will be minimal upon launch. We have incorporated a self-service module into the administrative panel, which will allow a customer to find the information they are looking for faster. This is an outstanding new feature of Widget 11 and something we are hoping will change the way our customers use the product. I have attached a small one-sheet on the new self-service panel, as well as a short description of any minor changes in the administration panel.
Great thanks for sending that document over, really clarified things for me. I am fully aligned now on the new admin panel. #alignment

message.body: Anyone have the latest sales deck? Meeting with a potential customer this afternoon. #help #sales

comment.text: @LindaAllen can you send the latest sales deck to Emily when you get a chance. Thanks
@EmilyJames see attached. This is revision 4. Please be sure to discard previous version. #salesdeck #sales #version4

message.body: I just had a great meeting with a client regarding our new Acme Widget 11. They said they loved the new design and really like the improvements in the software interface. It cut the configuration time in half, saving them time and money. @BobDavis great job revising the software. Our customers and the market are really validating the hard work you and your team put into this product.

comment.text: Thanks Brian. The team did a great job. Glad to hear that all the hard work and late hours paid off.
Did they mention anything about the new case design? We were interested in hearing feedback from customers on it.

message.body: @LindaAllen do you have the minutes from this weeks marketing meeting?

comment.text: See attached minutes.

message.body: @MikeWhittington The back office internet is still not working correctly. When doing product demos with customers, the pages lag and often freeze. Are we still waiting on a fix or did it go in? If it did, I don't think it is working. #internet

comment.text: I was using this back office earlier today and experienced similar results.
A fix was implemented this afternoon. Shouldn't have any issues moving forward.
Hooray for @MikeWhittington
Thanks Mike!!
Mike you made my week. The internet issue has been driving me nuts.

message.body: We are finalizing the new Widget 10 product page on the website. Wanted to get some help on the tweet button.

message.title: Does Saturday practice work for everyone? Be at the field at 9am!

comment.text: Works for me. See everyone there.
@PaulGandy Thanks for coordinating this team building event!

message.body: Drafting the new email campaign proposal. @StaceyLynch what products would you like to focus on for this campaign? #marketing #promotion

comment.text: Let's feature the Acme Widget 1, Acme Widget 10 and Acme Widget 12. Those are all key products that we need to continue to push into the market. When is this campaign slated to launch. I want to be sure the sales team is prepared. cc @PaulGandy
Thanks Stacey. We are planning on kicking this campaign off at the end of Q3. I will have an outline of the campaign for your team in a few weeks.

message.title: Presentation to General Vehicles today
message.body: This afternoon, I'm talking to Aaron Washington at GV about our behind-the-firewall solution. Our data is attached. Does anyone have recommendations about solidifying our partnership?

comment.text: I recommend showing them our SaaS security sheet too. Last year I spoke with Amanda Wang at GV and she was interested in understanding all of our security features. Good luck!

message.title: Widget 11 Product Team
message.body: A group for the research and implementation of Widget 10.
@BobDavis the new SSL certificate has been added to the website. It is registered to Acme Corp. Inc. Let me know if you have any questions / comments.

comment.text: Thanks Mike. Will let you know if I have any questions.
What was the final cost on this SSL certificate?

message.title: leaving for Interop/Software2010. See you in Vegas!

comment.text: Can't wait for this show. Last year we closed 115 deals. Looking forward to another smashing success this year.
Sounds good @EmilyJames. When are you checking into your hotel? We should try and grab a late dinner to discuss strategy for this show.

message.title: Software spend for 2010 should include Photoshop Elements 6
message.body: Considering that a lot of our sales are done through our website, using Elements will help when editing various pictures, images, pdfs, etc. You can try using a trial version of this tool at www.adobe.com. Please let me know what you think.

comment.text: I downloaded the tool, but am wondering if Fireworks would be a better fit for our team? Seems to be a little simpler to use.

message.title: Ticketing system...
message.body: We used to use Peregrine for our helpdesk/ticketing system, but we are reporting that that tool does not provide us what we need. Has anyone used another solution that has more comprehensive reporting features? Please share.

message.title: Does anyone know of any good recruiting services for programmers?
message.body: We are looking to fill a couple positions that have opened up in the last few months, and I have only tried monster.com and dice.com. Can anyone suggest other sites that have proven to be useful?

comment.text: Linkedin.com is another good one.

message.body:
Weekly Production Report:
15420 units 6 inspection rejects 3 faults
